title: Initial Design
content:
Documenting the initial design choices for the market simulator, including architecture, data handling, and agent interaction.

One of the core components is the price movement model. A common starting point for modeling asset prices is the Geometric Brownian Motion (GBM), which is described by the following stochastic differential equation:

$$ dS_t = \mu S_t dt + \sigma S_t dW_t $$

In this equation, $S_t$ represents the asset price at time $t$, $\mu$ is the drift coefficient (the expected return), and $\sigma$ is the volatility coefficient. The term $dW_t$ represents a Wiener process or Brownian motion.
